# The `iterator_facade_base` Class Template Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

CRTP base class which implements the entire standard iterator facade in terms of a minimal subset of the interface. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>template &lt;typename DerivedT, typename IteratorCategoryT, typename T, typename DifferenceTypeT = std::ptrdiff&#95;t, typename PointerT = T &#42;, typename ReferenceT = T &amp;&gt;
class llvm::iterator_facade_base&lt;DerivedT, IteratorCategoryT, T, DifferenceTypeT, PointerT, ReferenceT&gt;</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

CRTP base class which implements the entire standard iterator facade in terms of a minimal subset of the interface.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> this when it is reasonable to implement most of the iterator functionality in terms of a core subset. If you need special behavior or there are performance implications for this, you may want to override the relevant members instead.

Note, one abstraction that this does <em>not</em> provide is implementing subtraction in terms of addition by negating the difference. Negation isn&#39;t always information preserving, and I can see very reasonable iterator designs where this doesn&#39;t work well. It doesn&#39;t really force much added boilerplate anyways.

Another abstraction that this doesn&#39;t provide is implementing increment in terms of addition of one. These aren&#39;t equivalent for all iterator categories, and respecting that adds a lot of complexity for little gain.

Iterators are expected to have const rules analogous to pointers, with a single, const-qualified <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a2366b4a30c90d2207626fb717dfb778d">operator&#42;()</a> that returns ReferenceT. This matches the second and third pointers in the following example: 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">&#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> = &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a>; &#125;             </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ReferenceT &#39;int&amp;&#39;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">&#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> = &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a>; &#125;       </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ReferenceT &#39;int&amp;&#39;; const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">&#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> = &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a>; &#125;       </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ReferenceT &#39;const int&amp;&#39;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">&#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> = &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a>; &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ReferenceT &#39;const int&amp;&#39;; const</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing> If an iterator facade returns a handle to its own state, then T (and PointerT and ReferenceT) should usually be const-qualified. Otherwise, if clients are expected to modify the handle itself, the field can be declared mutable or use const&#95;cast.

Classes wishing to use <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/iterator-facade-base">iterator&#95;facade&#95;base</a></code> should implement the following methods:

Forward Iterators: (All of the following methods)
<ul>
<li>DerivedT &amp;operator=(const DerivedT &amp;R);</li>
<li>bool operator==(const DerivedT &amp;R) const;</li>
<li>T &amp;operator&#42;() const;</li>
<li>DerivedT &amp;<a href="#a10f99fd6afbddb5694dc277415dd143a">operator++()</a>;</li>
</ul>


Bidirectional Iterators: (All methods of forward iterators, plus the following)
<ul>
<li>DerivedT &amp;<a href="#a2b1add08071860fb4ce9f8b24b35271a">operator--()</a>;</li>
</ul>


Random-access Iterators: (All methods of bidirectional iterators excluding the following)
<ul>
<li>DerivedT &amp;<a href="#a10f99fd6afbddb5694dc277415dd143a">operator++()</a>;</li>
<li>DerivedT &amp;<a href="#a2b1add08071860fb4ce9f8b24b35271a">operator--()</a>; (and plus the following)</li>
<li>bool operator&lt;(const DerivedT &amp;RHS) const;</li>
<li>DifferenceTypeT operator-(const DerivedT &amp;R) const;</li>
<li>DerivedT &amp;operator+=(DifferenceTypeT N);</li>
<li>DerivedT &amp;operator-=(DifferenceTypeT N);</li>
</ul>

Definition at line 80 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/iterator-h">iterator.h</a>.
